title: Health & Body
description: Learn vocabulary about health, body parts, and visiting the doctor.

words.example: I have a terrible headache.
She has a high fever.
I got a stomachache after eating.
I can't stop coughing.
I have a sore throat.
I feel dizzy when I stand up.
Take this medicine three times a day.
words.exampleMeaning: 이 약을 하루에 세 번 드세요.

words.example: There's a pharmacy across the street.
You need a prescription for this medicine.
What symptoms do you have?
I have a doctor's appointment.
Call 911 in an emergency.
She has a leg injury.
You need to rest for a few days.
I keep sneezing.
I have seasonal allergies.
I have pain in my back.
Many people have the flu this winter.
words.exampleMeaning: 이번 겨울에 많은 사람들이 독감에 걸렸습니다.

words.example: Your blood pressure is normal.
Let me check your temperature.
Put a bandage on the cut.
We wish you a speedy recovery.
The treatment helped me feel better.
words.exampleMeaning: 그 치료가 기분이 나아지는 데 도움이 되었습니다.

words.example: The doctor's diagnosis was the flu.
I went to the clinic for a checkup.
He was rushed to the hospital.
The nurse checked my blood pressure.
The patient is recovering well.
The doctor did a thorough examination.
Take one pill after each meal.
The injection will help reduce the pain.
words.exampleMeaning: 주사가 통증을 줄이는 데 도움이 될 것입니다.

words.example: She needs surgery on her knee.
Do you have health insurance?
Call an ambulance immediately!
Dissolve the tablet in water.
Take two capsules twice a day.
words.exampleMeaning: 하루에 두 번, 두 캡슐씩 드세요.

words.example: Don't exceed the recommended dose.
This medicine has few side effects.
The wound is healing nicely.
The cut got an infection.
I need to see a doctor.
The surgeon performed the operation.
I have my annual checkup tomorrow.
Are you taking any medication?
He has chronic back pain.
She has acute appendicitis.
Wellness programs help employees stay healthy.
words.exampleMeaning: 웰니스 프로그램은 직원들이 건강을 유지하도록 돕습니다.

words.example: Vitamin C strengthens your immune system.
I need to take sick leave tomorrow.
The doctor reviewed my medical record.

exercises.question: Where do you buy medicine?
exercises.explanation: A pharmacy sells medicine.

exercises.question: I have a _____ and can't talk well. (sore throat)
exercises.explanation: A sore throat makes it hard to talk.

exercises.question: What is a high body temperature called?
exercises.explanation: A fever is when your body temperature is high.

exercises.question: I feel _____ when I stand up quickly. (dizzy)
exercises.explanation: Dizzy means feeling unsteady.

exercises.question: Match with Korean:
exercises.explanation: Match health terms with Korean meanings.

exercises.question: What do you call unexpected medical situations?
exercises.explanation: An emergency is urgent and unexpected.

exercises.question: You need a _____ from the doctor to get this medicine. (prescription)
exercises.explanation: A prescription is a doctor's order for medicine.

exercises.question: What happens when you have seasonal allergies?
exercises.explanation: Allergies often cause sneezing.

exercises.question: What _____ do you have? (symptoms)
exercises.explanation: Symptoms are signs of illness.

exercises.question: What is used to cover a wound?
exercises.explanation: A bandage covers and protects wounds.

exercises.question: I have a doctor's _____ at 3 PM. (appointment)
exercises.explanation: An appointment is a scheduled time to see the doctor.

exercises.question: What is 'flu' short for?
exercises.explanation: Flu is short for influenza.

exercises.question: The doctor will check your blood _____. (pressure)
exercises.explanation: Blood pressure is checked during medical exams.

exercises.question: What does 'recovery' mean?
exercises.explanation: Recovery means healing and getting better.

exercises.question: You should _____ and drink lots of water. (rest)
exercises.explanation: Rest helps your body heal.

exercises.question: 그는 만성 두통이 있습니다.
exercises.explanation: Chronic means long-lasting.

exercises.question: Who performs surgery?
exercises.explanation: A surgeon is a doctor who performs operations.

exercises.question: The _____ gave me an injection. (nurse)
exercises.explanation: Nurses often give injections.

exercises.question: I need to see a doctor.
exercises.explanation: See a doctor means to visit a doctor.

exercises.question: A clinic is larger than a hospital. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: A hospital is larger than a clinic.

exercises.question: What vehicle takes people to the hospital in emergencies?
exercises.explanation: An ambulance is used for medical emergencies.

exercises.question: Take two _____ with water. (pills)
exercises.explanation: Pills are taken orally with water.

exercises.question: Match the collocations: 'medical' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Medical treatment is a common collocation.

exercises.question: Which word has a silent 'p'? (Symptoms / Prescription)
exercises.explanation: The 'p' in symptoms is silent.

exercises.question: What does 'diagnosis' mean?
exercises.explanation: Diagnosis is the process of identifying a disease.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'I have high blood pressures.'
exercises.explanation: Blood pressure is uncountable.

exercises.question: The wound needs time for _____. (healing)
exercises.explanation: Healing is the process of getting better.

exercises.question: 감염을 예방하세요.
exercises.explanation: Prevent means to stop something from happening.

exercises.question: A capsule is a type of medicine. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: A capsule is a form of medication.

exercises.question: What is the correct dose of medicine called?
exercises.explanation: Dosage refers to the amount and frequency of medicine.

exercises.question: Order: feeling better / treatment / diagnosis / symptoms
exercises.explanation: This is the typical order of medical care.

exercises.question: This medicine may have some _____. (side effects)
exercises.explanation: Side effects are unwanted effects of medicine.

exercises.question: Match the opposites:
exercises.explanation: Chronic and acute are opposites; healing and infection are opposites.

exercises.question: What protects your body from disease?
exercises.explanation: The immune system fights diseases.

exercises.question: I need to take sick leave.
exercises.explanation: Sick leave is time off work due to illness.

exercises.question: The doctor looked at my _____. (medical record)
exercises.explanation: Medical records contain patient health information.

exercises.question: A tablet and a pill are the same thing. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Tablet and pill are synonyms.

exercises.question: What kind of doctor specializes in surgery?
exercises.explanation: A surgeon performs surgical operations.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'She has a high temperature fever.'
exercises.answer: She has a high fever. / She has a high temperature.
exercises.explanation: Don't use both temperature and fever together.

exercises.question: Match: 'annual' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Annual checkup is a common collocation.

exercises.question: Do you have _____? (health insurance)
exercises.explanation: Health insurance covers medical costs.

exercises.question: 그는 급성 위염이 있습니다.
exercises.explanation: Acute means sudden and severe.

exercises.question: What is another word for 'wellness'?
exercises.explanation: Wellness and wellbeing both mean being healthy.

exercises.question: Which word has /θ/ sound? (Throat / Treatment)
exercises.explanation: Throat has the /θ/ sound in 'th'.

exercises.question: Order: ambulance / emergency / hospital / call
exercises.explanation: This is the logical sequence in an emergency.

exercises.question: The _____ will see you now. (doctor)
exercises.explanation: Doctor is the person who examines patients.

exercises.question: Medication and medicine mean the same thing. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Medication and medicine are synonyms.

exercises.question: What is a regular health check called?
exercises.explanation: A checkup is a routine medical examination.

exercises.question: The patient is recovering well.
exercises.explanation: Recovering means getting better.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'I need see a doctor.'
exercises.answer: I need to see a doctor.
exercises.explanation: Need is followed by 'to' + verb.

exercises.question: Match: 'take' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Take medication is a common collocation.

exercises.question: She needs _____ on her ankle. (surgery)
exercises.explanation: Surgery is an operation to fix injuries.

exercises.question: Match the doctor types:
exercises.explanation: Match each medical professional with their role.

exercises.question: What do you call unwanted effects of medicine?
exercises.explanation: Side effects are unintended consequences of medication.

exercises.question: 복용량을 초과하지 마세요.
exercises.explanation: Exceed means go beyond the limit.

exercises.question: The _____ took my blood pressure. (nurse)
exercises.explanation: Nurses check vital signs like blood pressure.

exercises.question: An injection is the same as a pill. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: An injection is given with a needle; a pill is swallowed.

exercises.question: Order: recovery / treatment / rest / illness
exercises.explanation: This is the progression from illness to health.

exercises.question: Where would you go for a minor health issue?
exercises.explanation: A clinic handles routine and minor health issues.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'The doctor gave me a prescriptions.'
exercises.answer: The doctor gave me a prescription.
exercises.explanation: Prescription is singular after 'a'.

exercises.question: Which word has stress on the second syllable? (Recovery / Medicine)
exercises.explanation: Recovery is stressed on the second syllable: re-CO-very.

exercises.question: Call an _____ for an emergency! (ambulance)
exercises.explanation: An ambulance responds to emergencies.

exercises.question: Boost your immune system.
exercises.explanation: Boost means to increase or strengthen.

exercises.question: Match: 'chronic' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Chronic pain is a common collocation.

exercises.question: What does a pharmacist do?
exercises.explanation: A pharmacist prepares and gives out medicine.

exercises.question: I have a _____ tomorrow at 10 AM. (checkup)
exercises.explanation: A checkup is a scheduled medical examination.

exercises.question: Wellness means being sick. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Wellness means being healthy and well.

exercises.question: Match the terms:
exercises.explanation: Match each medical term with its description.

exercises.question: 의료 기록을 업데이트하세요.
exercises.explanation: Update means to make current.

exercises.question: Order: pharmacy / prescription / doctor / medicine
exercises.explanation: This is the typical order to get medicine.

exercises.question: What is the process of identifying a disease called?
exercises.explanation: Diagnosis is determining what illness a patient has.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'I'm feeling very dizziness.'
exercises.answer: I'm feeling very dizzy. / I have dizziness.
exercises.explanation: After 'feeling', use the adjective 'dizzy', not the noun 'dizziness'.

exercises.question: She has a bacterial _____. (infection)
exercises.explanation: Infection is when germs invade the body.

exercises.question: Match: 'blood' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Blood pressure is a common collocation.

exercises.question: The wound is healing nicely.
exercises.explanation: Healing nicely means recovering well.

exercises.question: Which is NOT a form of medicine?
exercises.explanation: Examination is a medical check, not a form of medicine.

exercises.question: A surgeon is a type of doctor. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: A surgeon is a doctor who performs operations.

exercises.question: I need to take _____ for two days. (sick leave)
exercises.explanation: Sick leave is time off work due to illness.

exercises.question: Which word ends with /ʃən/ sound? (Injection / Capsule)
exercises.explanation: Injection ends with the /ʃən/ sound.

exercises.question: Match synonyms:
exercises.explanation: Match each word with its synonym.

exercises.question: 정기 검진을 받으세요.
exercises.explanation: Regular checkup means routine health examination.

exercises.question: What covers medical expenses?
exercises.explanation: Health insurance pays for medical costs.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'I have high fevers.'
exercises.explanation: Fever is usually singular when referring to one episode.

exercises.question: Order: hospital / ambulance / emergency / arrive
exercises.explanation: This is the sequence of emergency transport.

exercises.question: Take the _____ with food. (medication)
exercises.explanation: Some medications should be taken with food.

exercises.question: Match: 'speedy' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Speedy recovery is a common wish for sick people.

exercises.question: Acute means long-lasting. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Acute means sudden and severe, not long-lasting.

exercises.question: She underwent surgery yesterday.
exercises.explanation: Undergo surgery means to have an operation.

exercises.question: Who takes care of patients in hospitals?
exercises.explanation: Nurses provide direct patient care.

exercises.question: The doctor made a _____. (diagnosis)
exercises.explanation: Diagnosis is the identification of an illness.

exercises.question: Match antonyms:
exercises.explanation: Match each word with its opposite.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'The nurse give me an injection.'
exercises.answer: The nurse gave me an injection. / The nurse gives me an injection.
exercises.explanation: Verb tense must match; use 'gave' for past or 'gives' for present.

exercises.question: Which word has silent 'gh'? (Cough / Capsule)
exercises.explanation: The 'gh' in cough is silent.

exercises.question: 그는 규칙적으로 약을 복용합니다.
exercises.explanation: Regularly means at consistent intervals.

exercises.question: Apply a clean _____ to the wound. (bandage)
exercises.explanation: A bandage protects wounds from infection.

exercises.question: A clinic is only for emergencies. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Clinics handle routine care; emergency rooms handle emergencies.

exercises.question: Match: 'make' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Make an appointment is a common collocation.

exercises.question: What shows a patient's health history?
exercises.explanation: Medical records document a patient's health history.

exercises.question: Order: take medicine / feel better / see symptoms / visit doctor
exercises.explanation: This is the typical sequence of getting medical care.

exercises.question: Don't exceed the recommended dose.
exercises.explanation: Recommended dose is the suggested amount.

exercises.question: This will strengthen your _____. (immune system)
exercises.explanation: The immune system protects against disease.

exercises.question: What is a thorough medical check called?
exercises.explanation: An examination is a detailed medical check.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'She has chronic headaches pain.'
exercises.answer: She has chronic headaches. / She has chronic headache pain.
exercises.explanation: Don't use both headaches and pain together unnecessarily.

exercises.question: Side effects are always dangerous. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Side effects can be mild or serious.

exercises.question: Match the medical places:
exercises.explanation: Match each place with its primary function.

exercises.question: 그녀는 간호사입니다.
exercises.explanation: A nurse is a medical professional who cares for patients.

exercises.question: Match: 'get' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Get an injection is a common collocation.

exercises.question: The _____ was successful. (surgery)
exercises.explanation: Surgery is an operation performed by surgeons.

exercises.question: Which word has stress on the first syllable? (Patient / Recovery)
exercises.explanation: Patient is stressed on the first syllable: PA-tient.

exercises.question: What term describes overall health and happiness?
exercises.explanation: Wellness refers to overall health and wellbeing.

exercises.question: Order: diagnosis / symptoms appear / treatment starts / patient recovers
exercises.explanation: This is the typical medical care progression.

exercises.question: I have seasonal allergies.
exercises.explanation: Seasonal allergies occur at certain times of the year.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'I must to rest for a week.'
exercises.answer: I must rest for a week.
exercises.explanation: Modal verb 'must' is followed directly by the base verb.

exercises.question: Take one _____ three times daily. (capsule)
exercises.explanation: Capsules are taken orally like pills.

exercises.question: A surgeon and a doctor are different professions. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: A surgeon is a type of doctor.

exercises.question: Match: 'high' goes with:
exercises.explanation: High fever is a common collocation.

exercises.question: What do you need from a doctor to buy certain medicines?
exercises.explanation: A prescription is required for certain medications.

exercises.question: 병원 침대가 필요합니다.
exercises.explanation: Hospital bed is where patients stay in hospitals.

exercises.question: Match the verbs with nouns:
exercises.explanation: Match each verb with the appropriate medical noun.

exercises.question: The cut is showing signs of _____. (infection)
exercises.explanation: Infection occurs when germs enter a wound.

exercises.question: Which word has /dʒ/ sound? (Surgery / Checkup)
exercises.explanation: Surgery has the /dʒ/ sound in 'g'.

exercises.question: What is the medical term for healing?
exercises.explanation: Recovery is the process of healing.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'She has a pain back.'
exercises.answer: She has back pain. / She has a pain in her back.
exercises.explanation: The word order is 'back pain' or 'pain in back'.

exercises.question: The medication has few side effects.
exercises.explanation: Few side effects means minimal unwanted effects.

exercises.question: Order: pain relief / take medicine / feel pain / swallow pill
exercises.explanation: This is the sequence of taking pain medication.

exercises.question: I have my _____ checkup next week. (annual)
exercises.explanation: Annual means once a year.

exercises.question: Health insurance covers all medical expenses for free. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Health insurance typically has copays, deductibles, and limitations.

exercises.question: Match: 'common' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Common symptoms means frequently occurring signs.

exercises.question: What protects a wound?
exercises.explanation: A bandage covers and protects wounds.

exercises.question: 급성 질환은 갑자기 나타납니다.
exercises.explanation: Acute means sudden onset.

exercises.question: The patient's _____ shows past illnesses. (medical record)
exercises.explanation: Medical records contain health history.

exercises.question: Match the word families:
exercises.explanation: Match verbs with their noun forms.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'The doctor given me medicine.'
exercises.answer: The doctor gave me medicine. / The doctor has given me medicine.
exercises.explanation: Use correct past tense 'gave' or present perfect 'has given'.

exercises.question: What do you call time off work when sick?
exercises.explanation: Sick leave is authorized absence due to illness.

exercises.question: Which word has a long /iː/ sound? (Healing / Capsule)
exercises.explanation: Healing has the long /iː/ sound in 'ea'.

exercises.question: Make an appointment with your doctor.
exercises.explanation: Make an appointment means to schedule a visit.

exercises.question: Vitamin C boosts your _____. (immune system)
exercises.explanation: The immune system fights off diseases.

exercises.question: All medicines require a prescription. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Some medicines are over-the-counter (no prescription needed).

exercises.question: Match: 'fill' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Fill a prescription means to get the medicine.

exercises.question: Order: get better / rest / take medicine / feel sick
exercises.explanation: This is the typical recovery sequence.

exercises.question: What is another word for doctor?
exercises.explanation: Physician is a formal term for doctor.

exercises.question: 이 약은 하루에 세 번 복용하세요.
answer: Take this medicine three times a day.
Take this medication three times daily.
exercises.explanation: Three times a day means morning, afternoon, and evening.

exercises.question: Find the error: 'I have a flu.'
exercises.answer: I have the flu. / I have flu.
exercises.explanation: Use 'the flu' or just 'flu' without 'a'.

exercises.question: The _____ will perform the operation. (surgeon)
exercises.explanation: A surgeon is a doctor who does surgery.

exercises.question: Match the actions:
exercises.explanation: Match each verb with the appropriate medical noun.

exercises.question: Chronic and acute mean the same thing. (True/False)
exercises.explanation: Chronic means long-term; acute means sudden and severe.

exercises.question: Match: 'physical' goes with:
exercises.explanation: Physical examination is a common medical term.

exercises.question: The ambulance arrived quickly.
exercises.explanation: Ambulance is an emergency vehicle.

exercises.question: What is a medical facility smaller than a hospital?
exercises.explanation: A clinic is smaller than a hospital.

exercises.question: Which word has stress on the third syllable? (Examination / Medication)
exercises.explanation: Medication is stressed on the third syllable: med-i-CA-tion.
